answers.answer: Hi!I am sorry to hear about your grand mother. Demyelinating neuropathies are conditions in which the myelin layer covering the nerve gets destroyed and is caused by many types of toxins, nerve disorders, autoimmune disorders etc. The most commonly known condition of this type is Guillain-Barré syndrome. Other than this, if she has diabetes or thyroid problems or atherosclerosis or clotting disorders, then it can cause brain bleeds and hyperintense areas in brain on MRI—all these can also case many neurological symptoms. All these findings means she must be having nerve and muscle weakness, which could be progressive in nature.
